2025/04/26, 8:52â€¯pm - +27 63 667 1000: *When is the best time to send a follow-up email?*

The best time to send a follow up email after applying for a job is two weeks after you applied. You may wish to follow up an application if you didnâ€™t receive confirmation that it was received or if you have not heard if you got an interview after two weeks. 

*Should I follow up if the job posting doesn't specify a deadline?*

Yes, you can follow up on a job application even if the job ad doesnâ€™t specify a deadline. Many recruiters and hiring managers will send a message if you have not been successful, but not all of them will. You might want to send a follow up to clarify the status of your application and whether you are still in consideration for the role.  

*How long should I wait for a response after sending a follow-up email?*

If you donâ€™t receive a response to your follow-up email after youâ€™ve applied for a job, itâ€™s best to wait another week or two before sending a final follow-up. You can also check online to see if the job ad is still posted â€“ if itâ€™s not, it may already have been filled.

2025/04/27, 12:14â€¯pm - +27 63 667 1000: Since tomorrow is Monday, Let me teach you about dropping off CV's. 

1-When dropping off CV's, Monday and Tuesday are perfect day . Reason being most companies bashota by Mondays.

2- Be clean, this one is important. Don't look like your problems.

3- When you get to the store, say for example Jet Store, don't ask the security about the store  hiring, security's don't really know and even If they do chances are that they won't tell you.

4- When you get to the shop, greet the security than pass like you are there to shop, then check for workers the one you think it's approachable. 

5- Ask for the manger.

6-Be polite !! A KEY TO MANY DOORS!

7- First Greet her, then shower her with compliments.  After that then you ask if the company does have any vacancies available,then give her/him your CV.

Come on guys let's help each other out

2025/05/16, 12:36â€¯pm - +27 75 359 8387: LEARNERSHIPS
A Learnership is a work-based education and training programme that is linked to a qualification registered on the National Qualifications Framework (NQF) with the South African Qualifications Authority (SAQA). Learnerships are occupationally directed programmes that consist of both structured theoretical learning and practical workplace experience.
A Learnership is a work-based education and training programme that is linked to a qualification registered on the National Qualifications Framework (NQF) with the South African Qualifications Authority (SAQA). Learnerships are occupationally directed programmes that consist of both structured theoretical learning and practical workplace experience.
What are the benefits of learnerships?

For the Learner:

Provide easy access to learning;
Increase access to employment opportunities;
Assist in Career-Pathing and Self-development;
Provide a monthly stipend to learners while they learn;
Lead to the acquisition of a formal qualification; and
Serve as an entrance into the industry for unemployed learners.
For the Employer:

Provide skilled and experienced workers;
Assist in the development of competent staff;
Contribute to empowerment credentials and BB-BEE points for the company;
Produce knowledgeable and competent employees who require less supervision;
Lead to improved workplace productivity and quality outcomes;
A vehicle to address employment equity targets; and
Help fill identified skills gaps.
For the Industry:

Help industry to become competitive in the global market;
Build a pool of skilled, qualified &amp; more professional workforce; and
Develop their people to world-class standards.

Who participates in a learnership?

A learnership involves three main parties:

The learner/s
The training provider/s
The employer/s
How to apply for a learnership?
Although the SETA facilitates the recruitment and implementation of learnerships, the responsibility lies with the employer, the service provider and training provider to recruit learners.

For more information on learnership programmes, please contact Potego Magolego at  

cv@mict.org.za.

We are pleased to inform you that exciting Cashier job vacancies are currently available at reputable companies across various locations. If you are a motivated, detail-oriented individual with a passion for customer service, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Position: Cashier
Location: Multiple branches (details available upon application)
Job Type: Full-Time / Part-Time (depending on location)

Key Responsibilities:

Efficiently handle cash, card, and other transactions at the point of sale.

Greet customers and provide professional, friendly service.

Maintain a clean and organized checkout area.

Assist with stock and store housekeeping when necessary.

Promote store loyalty programs and current promotions.

Requirements:

Grade 12 or equivalent.

Strong communication and numerical skills.

Customer service experience will be an advantage.

Reliability, punctuality, and attention to detail.

Ability to work flexible retail hours, including weekends.

We encourage individuals who are passionate about retail and customer service to apply. Whether you're starting your career or looking for your next challenge, we welcome your application.

To apply, please reply to this email with your updated CV, or click the link below to submit your application online:

>>>www.cashierjobs.com

If you do not hear from us within 14 days of your application, please consider your application unsuccessful.

We wish you the best of luck in your job search!

Kind regards

Mr Molepo

Location: Blackheath, Western Cape
Closing Date: 15 June 2025
Duration: 12 months

Cani Rusks, in partnership with FoodBev SETA, invites unemployed South African youth to apply for a 12-month Learnership Programme leading to an Occupational Certificate: Production Operator (NQF Level 3).

About the Learnership:
This structured programme includes both theoretical learning and practical, on-the-job training to prepare you for a career in the fast-paced manufacturing and food production industry.

Qualification Outcome:
Occupational Certificate: Production Operator
NQF Level 3 (12 months)
Accredited by FoodBev SETA
Monthly stipend provided (as per SETA guidelines)

Minimum Entry Requirements:
South African citizen, aged 18â€“35
Currently unemployed
Grade 12/Matric Certificate (Maths and Science are advantageous)
Interest in food production and manufacturing
Willingness to commit to the full duration of the programme
Good communication and teamwork skills

What Youâ€™ll Learn:
Operating production line equipment
Maintaining hygiene and food safety standards
Understanding standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Basic technical and food production information
Workplace safety in the food industry

How to Apply:
Email your:
CV
Certified copy of your ID
Matric Certificate
Short motivational letter

To: meghan@canirusks.co.za and nikki@emcon.net.za
Deadline: 15 June 2025

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Preference will be given to candidates from designated groups, in line with employment equity targets.

Share with someone who might benefit from this opportunity.

Grade 12.

Minimum of 2 yearsâ€™ Maintenance experience preferably within the FMCG environment.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS

Duties & Responsibilities
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Ensure that best practices in planning are applied to improve the efficiency of maintenance

Implement and maintain a proper maintenance strategy and philosophy

Develop time estimates of planned maintenance work

Ensure that good store management practices  are applied to retain the full reliability of stored parts and equipment

Implement planning boards

Ensure that all necessary documentation to perform the maintenance work are available

Write applicable maintenance procedures that promote defect-free maintenance work quality

Schedule maintenance work into the production plan

Ensure that Key Performance Indicators are captured and reported for equipment reliability, maintenance department performances and planning and scheduling business flow processes

Industry: Retail - in store
Description
WHOLESALE AND RETAIL NQF LEVEL 3 LEARNERSHIP OPPORTUNITY â€“ APPLICATIONS NOW OPEN

Are you passionate about building a career in retail? Are you prepared to work long hours in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? This is your opportunity to apply for a Wholesale and Retail NQF Level 3 Learnership, open to both people living with a disability and able-bodied individuals.

1. APPLICATION LOCATIONS

We are currently sourcing applicants from the following areas and their surroundings:

Sandton City
Menlyn
East Rand
2. MINIMUM ENTRY REQUIREMENTS

To qualify for this opportunity, applicants must:

Have completed Matric (Grade 12)
Be currently unemployed
Not be registered on any other SETA-funded programme
Not be pursuing any higher education qualification
Demonstrate a genuine interest in the retail sector
Be willing to work long hours and weekends if required

3. REQUIRED DOCUMENTS FOR APPLICATION

All documents must be certified and clearly visible. Submit the following:

For all applicants:

Updated Curriculum Vitae (CV)
Two (2) certified copies of your ID
Two (2) certified copies of your Matric Certificate
Recent three (3) monthsâ€™ bank statement
Three (3) affidavits, each confirming:

That you are currently unemployed
Your highest qualification
Your residential address
Additional documents for applicants living with a disability:

Two (2) copies of a medical confirmation of disability (e.g., doctorâ€™s letter or relevant medical report)

2) Must have grade 9-12

3) Must be disabled

4) Must have doctors report

5) must be between the ages of 18 - 35

These are learnerships available for PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES only

People with eyesight impairment e.g. you wear glasses to rectify your vision..may also apply. Hearing impairments also welcome but must be using a hearing aid.

Regret no psychological impairments as client cant cater for some of these needs.

Start date:Immediately

Stipend R5000pm

Learnerships: Business Administration, Contact centre and Systems Support

Please send Cv, ID, Results,Sars document,Bank confirmation and Doctors report to :
Joannesmit90@gmail.com
Alternatively Call/WhatsApp 083 667 4205

- your proof of disability (if you have a disability)
- proof of address

2025/09/26, 2:28â€¯am - +27 73 986 7603: When emailing a PDF CV, keep the email brief and proffesional.

Here is an Email Example:
Subject: Application for General Worker Position

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to apply for the General Worker/Driver position at [Company Name]. I have attached my CV, which provides more details about my experience and qualifications.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss my qualifications further.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

By following these tips, you'll make a positive impression on the hiring manager and increase the chances of your application being considered.
